meanings.definition: To make less tight or firm
meanings.sent1: She used a wrench to loosen the bolt.
meanings.sent2: After a long day, he decided to loosen his tie.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar finally opened after she tried to loosen it for the tenth time.
meanings.sent4: His strict rules began to loosen as he realized the importance of flexibility.
meanings.sent5: The grip of fear started to loosen its hold on her as she took deep breaths.

meanings.definition: To become less tight or firm
meanings.sent1: The knot started to loosen as she pulled on the rope.
meanings.sent2: As the temperature rose, the soil began to loosen.
meanings.sent3: The tension in the room seemed to loosen as they all shared a laugh.
meanings.sent4: His muscles began to loosen up after the warm-up exercises.
meanings.sent5: The grip of winter slowly started to loosen its icy fingers on the land.
